Comments_List: I learned that if I wanted to learn (read: hear) anything in class, I need to sit in the first couple rows of the room.

physical organic knowledge
computation methods
famous scientists that made great contribution to organic chem
I learned principles of physical organic chemistry.
Bond Energies and conformational energies

pretty much nothing. We re-learned how to draw lewis dot structures. I learned how to do that in high school. then we learned completely useless pieces of info that will never ever come up again for the rest of our careers. this class was a waste of time.
Conformation analysis, pericyclic reaction, supramolecular chemistry etc
Conformational analysis, solvent effects, pericyclic reactions
I learned how to relate properties of molecules and reactions with the strain and interactions associated with it.
Understanding in physical organic chemistry.
I learned to think about orbitals and conformational analysis in a clearer way
I learned about the different physical organic topics.

This course can be improved if the instructor was actually organized about what he wants to teach. Often times, I have no idea what is being covered, and the syllabus does not align with class material at times.
sometimes cannot figure out the handwriting

The course was not very well organized.

The course offered a level of detail into the history of science and scientific figures that might be unparalleled in the nation.
The first thing he told us is that he would not read any of the evaluations.
I think that the strength was the TA, Maria-Elena. It seemed that the assessments for the course were often definitely not reflective of the material covered in lecture.

Not taught effectively. Content could be extremely interesting and useful. Should be more interactive. Tests should reflect material brought up in class. Material should be given enough context. Discuss trends more and specific reasons for abnormal behavior versus throwing out numbers. Only strength was good TF.

strengths: none. I only was able to learn because our TF (Maria-Elena) was an ANGEL. She was the only teacher we actually had because Bill CAN'T TEACH

weakness: everything about this class. exams were not reflective of the material covered in class, lectures were filled with pointless tangents.

-the course, while rich in information, lacks cohesion between topics
-the instructor is clearly knowledgeable but for some reason is not enthusiastic about the subject matter
-the strongest and most effective component of this class was the TA
This course contains too much computational content. It'll be better if there're more organic aspect
Too much historical background not enough chemistry
The lectures were well organized and interesting in the first half of the semester but in the latter half the lectures became a bit difficult to follow.
The course is well organized. But the part for pericyclic reactions was a little bit rushed.
I liked the review notes our TA gave us, and I liked how the information was written on the board for us in real time as Dr. Jorgensen lectured
The course was very boring, so much that usually by about 5 minutes in, everyone was on their phone ignoring Bill.
Yes. Good course. we can learn useful things.
I would recommend this course, but I might recommend it more narrowly than I would have before taking it.
It's probably a good course to take but was very boring the way it was presented.

The class (as taught by Bill) was really boring, but the information was important. So I guess I would recommend it on that. The TA (Maria-Elena) was the best, because she made sure we learned the information.
